page.title: 14Local concerns.
page.content: Nearly 50 adults were interviewed at their door and in the street. Amongst the questions asked were "What do you consider was/is the most important local event of the past few months?" No single issue occupied all minds'. Responces included a recent increase in domestic rates, unemployment in general, the parking of motor cars on pavements, new motor bus routes, the proposed abolition of 'Merseyside' as an administrative unit, and the cutting down of trees on a local avenue. Of concern to local small shopkeepers was the building of a new "Quicksave" supermarket near the middle of Rainhill on a previously derelict site. Supermarkets are usually able to sell their goods at proces lower than smaller shops because their 'turnover' is relatively rapid: the larger volume
